pullRequest.body:
Remove `@[simp]` from `Nat.bit_false` and `Nat.bit_true`, as `bit0` and `bit1` are deprecated, and add some lemmas to `Bits`, `Bitwise` and `Size`.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body: LGTM!

> I'm curious what you're using this for - I had it in the back of my mind to remove everything about `bit` at some point

I'm using it for #12750.

</summary>

`+ add_pow_testBit`
`+ and_div2`
`+ bit_false_succ`
`+ bit_true_succ`
`+ bitwise_div2`
`+ div2_testBit`

`+ size_eq_iff_le_and_lt`

`+ xor_div2`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

</details>
I know you need these lemmas, but I'm afraid they have no good home anymore. Mind merging master to sort that out?
Perhaps they could all go to `Mathlib.Data.Nat.Bits`? I think I'll try to update #12750 and see what I need
This looks like it's pretty close to being mergeable. Could you please merge master and resolve the conflicts?
I'm curious what you're using this for - I had it in the back of my mind to remove everything about `bit` at some point
I'm curious what you're using this for - I had it in the back of my mind to remove everything about `bit` at some point

```suggestion
lemma div2_testBit (n : ) (i : ) : n.div2.testBit i = n.testBit (i + 1) := by
```

```suggestion
  intro
  simp only [div2_testBit, testBit_bitwise, h]
```

```suggestion
  | i + 1 => by
```

```suggestion
lemma add_pow_testBit (n : ) : (i : )  (n + 2 ^ i).testBit i = !n.testBit i
```

```suggestion
  apply n.bitCasesOn
  rcases; simp [testBit_bit_zero, -testBit_zero]
```

```suggestion
    exact add_pow_testBit (n / 2) i
```

```suggestion
    rw [ lt_size, h]
    apply lt_succ_self
    exact h  lt_size_self n
   rintro h1, h2
    apply le_antisymm
    exact size_le.mpr h2
    exact succ_le_iff.mp (lt_size.mpr h1)
```

```suggestion
    have j, _, h := ge_two_pow_implies_high_bit_true lb
    have t (j : ) (hj : j > i) : n.testBit j = false :=
      testBit_lt_two_pow (ub.trans_le (Nat.pow_le_pow_right (by decide) hj))
    convert And.intro h t
    suffices j  i by omega
    by_contra nh
    rw [ Bool.true_eq_false]
    exact h  t j (not_le.mp nh)
   rintro h1, h2
    exact testBit_implies_ge h1, lt_pow_two_of_testBit n h2
```

```suggestion
lemma size_eq_iff_le_and_lt (n : ) (i : ) : n.size = i + 1  2 ^ i  n  n < 2 ^ (i+1) := by
```

```suggestion
     exact size_le.mpr h2
     exact succ_le_iff.mp (lt_size.mpr h1)
```

```suggestion
lemma size_eq_iff_le_and_lt (n : ) (i : ) : n.size = i + 1  2 ^ i  n  n < 2 ^ (i + 1) :=
    fun h => (lt_size.mp <| h  lt_succ_self _), h  lt_size_self _,
    fun h => le_antisymm (size_le.mpr h.2) <| succ_le_iff.mp <| lt_size.mpr h.1
```

```suggestion
  refine fun h  ?_, fun h  ?_
   have j, _, h' := ge_two_pow_implies_high_bit_true h.1
    have t (j : ) (hj : j > i) : n.testBit j = false :=
      testBit_lt_two_pow <| (h.2).trans_le <| Nat.pow_le_pow_right (by decide) hj
    suffices j  i by convert And.intro h' t; omega
    by_contra nh
    exact Bool.true_eq_false.mp <| h'  t j (not_le.mp nh)
   exact testBit_implies_ge h.1, lt_pow_two_of_testBit n h.2
```

```suggestion
  rw [testBit_succ, div2_val]
```

```suggestion
  apply eq_of_testBit_eq
```

```suggestion
lemma bit_true_succ (n : ) : bit true n + 1 = bit false (n + 1) := by
```

```suggestion
lemma bit_false_succ (n : ) : bit false n + 1 = bit true n := by
```

```suggestion
  rw [bit_val, bit_val]
  rfl
```
What's this `rcases` doing? I don't think I've seen it without an argument before
It seems like it didn't do anything, so I've removed it.

The proof should be indented only two spaces.

Optional: I've started writing proofs like this as
```suggestion
lemma size_eq_iff_le_and_lt (n : ) (i : ) : n.size = i + 1  2 ^ i  n  n < 2 ^ (i + 1) where
  mp h := lt_size.mp <| h  lt_succ_self _, h  lt_size_self _
  mpr h := le_antisymm (size_le.mpr h.2) <| succ_le_iff.mp <| lt_size.mpr h.1
```

pullRequest.title: feat: add lemmas for Nat/Bits, Nat/Bitwise and Nat/Size
